intro: Apinagia nitelloides, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions of North America. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, white or pale pink flowers. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Apinagia nitelloides plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations to extreme climates.
